rComments: 100% DO NOT recommend taking this class for a GE-my mistake. This class is the definition of illogical. Teacher is very smart but horrible at teaching. MSI was very helpful and probably the only reason i passed this class. This class was a constant headache.

I'm not sure why this Prof. has such bad reviews. This class is pretty hard and he does go through the material a little fast which can make it confusing or hard to understand, but he is more than willing to answer any questions after class or during office hours. Also the sections are more for giving a clearer understanding as well as the MSIs.
Intro to Logic was just awful. Bowin is a brilliant man but a terrible teacher. Lectures were pretty pointless and can be equated to watching someone do their homework over a projector.

I found Professor Bowin to be an excellent instructor. He encourages participation and offers extra credit for it! As long as you make an effort to stay somewhat engagedask questions when you're confused this class will be a breeze. He does get a little wrapped up in the history sometimes, but is always willing to answer student questions
One of the rudest and disrespectful people I have ever met in my entire life, he does not deserve to be on this campus.

Presents himself as helpful and open to questions but politely scoffs at any attempts made to clarify his material. Only thinks in the language of the class, making his feedback convoluted. If you're taking this course graded, godspeed. Otherwise make sure you do well on the homework, come to lectures, and try to do the extra cred to pass. Or flee!

Lectures are mandatory but i never got much out of them. Sections were incredibly helpful, and going to MSI helped some too. This class takes a lot of time and effort but i found it rewarding. But it was really no cakewalk. Start yr own study group to get ahead.

You can see he knows what he is talking about but if you are not a philosophy major (or similar field) then you will be completely lost. If you are taking this instead of a math course to complete your MF requirement, do not take this class. Especially for those who have problems with math or learning disabilities, this  course is challenging.

This guy is the worst. He lectures on and on about random philosophical theories and philosophers and makes it very unclear. Good thing his class doesn't require you to take notes because if you do the readings (skim main ideas for most part) and go to section and sign in for lecture you will do at least a B. I did not enjoy his class

He really cares about the subject matter and wants his students to also. Yes attendance is mandatory and sometimes lecture can be a little dry but Bowin is passionate about teaching and if you're ACTUALLY interested in Philosophy you'll be rewarded and find him extremely helpful. Read everything. Write concisely and throughly. Engage lecture/sect

Bowin is a very scholarly professor. Very prompt with response to email questions. Took his intro to logic class and also his contemporary analytic metaphysics class. You have to do what he says to do well in logic, and in metaphysics, you need to show that you have had a solid interaction with the material. Not hard to do if you like school.
Bowin seems like he really cares about people understanding the material but he isn't very clear since he uses terminology people might not have a firm grasp on and often corrects himself.
Nice guy. Not many people find logic to be very intuitive and it is hard to explain. Difficult class.

Seemingly a nice fellow. Unfortunately is completely detached and unempathetic when it comes to the students grasp of the subject. Is more concerned about strictly adhering to his arbitrary syllabus than actually ensuring that his students are learning logic.

Bowin is a nice guy, he has great to pretty good TA's. The class is tough, don't take it if you don't have to. He teaches the basics during class but the homework will often have much harder problems. His lecture style puts lots of kids to sleep. His tests seem really scary but they aren't bad. If you skip class you will probably fail it.

Overall an average professor. I only went to a few lectures because the material was, at first, painfully easy to understand, and then later, painfully difficult to listen to. Can't really say much about the guy. He kind of hesitates in explaining some things, so I have to assume that he doesn't know the material as well as I'd like. Cool guy, thou

Very intelligent, but he fails to convey the subject material in an engaging way (granted logic isn't THAT interesting). Homework is based on accuracy, which at first seems unnerving b/c its worth 35% of your grade. However, he is very generous with curves, and cured our total homework grade, as well as our midterm and final. Overall a decent prof.

Professor Bowen really brought about a greater interest in Ancient Greek Philosophy for me.  I appreciate the analytic approach, the well organized lectures, and flow of discussion.  I highly recommend this professor and hope that I will have another class with him in the future.
This was my favorite class.  I would definitely take another class from Bowin.  He encouraged class discussion and answered student's questions well.
I agree with the last entry. Not boring at all.  But Bowin is an analytic philosopher,so don't expect aimless discussions about the meaning of life or continental obscuritanism.
Great class.  Not at all boring if you like philosophy.  Bowin has good energy, and sparked my curiosity in ancient philosophy.

Bowin seemed a little too into learning just what the philosophers said and wasn't to happy to have a discussion on the topics as philosophy classes should. He was okay over all, got to the point, but was a little boring.

Alright, I dont want to rant but yes this guy is boring. He knows what he is talking about but has bad control over the class and struggles to answer student's questions on the fly. I did well in the class but I did not find it interesting or helpful.

yes the class was boring, but he is not at all bad professor. he is actually super intelligent and the problem most students have is just that we are all intellectually beneath him. ancient greek gets boring, and it is hard, but not too hard to keep up. so dont get discouraged!

Worst philosophy professor at UCSC. His lectures were nothing more then dry summaries of the texts. Making it through an entire lecture was impossible. He was inconsiderate of students problems, and gave dull and narrow paper topics. Avoid at all costs...

I had this guy for two classes, and they were both horrible.  The guy is just so boring.  Im not saying he isnt smart, im just saying he'd put a tweaked out speed freak to sleep like it was nothing.  Phil 9 was the most confusing class ive ever had.  Overall, terrible. Stay away.

Brand new teacher, so the lectures weren't too smooth at the beginning.  near the end he began to lecture more conversationally.  this man knows what he's taking about, but the delivery is still that of a new prof.  I am looking forward to taking another class w/him now that he has experience.  He's looking to be one of the better profs at @ ucsc
Lectures were unbearable, very long homework that counts for a lot, class avg for hw and tests was very low, made hw due the day we came back from thanksgiving break, run away....faster.

New teacher that is still developing his style.  This guy is an encyclopedia of Ancient Greek Philosophy.  Although the lecture was pretty slow at the start, he improved dramatically through the quarter.  He will undoubtedly find his style and mature into a fantastic instructor.
Knows his**** better than you know the back of your hand. Lectures were horrific in the beginning of the term but got better towards the end. He will be a great professor with some more experience
The worst professor I've had

Over half the class dropped or withdrew, on top of that over 30 people didn't show up to the midterm because they were dropping shortly after. This guy has been the worst professor I have ever had, hands down. On top of this, the T/A's were not sympathetic to the students whatsoever.
This professor never understands what the students ask, half the class is failing and he is just terrible at teaching logic to any of us.
Horrible teacher. Lectures too organized and convoluted. Teaches like a banker, and has the public speaking abilities of one as well.
